document_data.name: Wulf
document_data.mainbody:
'''Wulf''' was a dutiful hireling guard who worked for [[Baldur's Mouth]] in the [[Baldur's Gate/Lower City|Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|''Don't bother workers out here. They're already behind on deliveries without you lot pestering them.''|Wulf}}
document_data.Description: Wulf was a [[human]] man with bronze skin, gray eyes, and dark hair.
document_data.Possessions: Wulf was equipped with a simple [[chainmail]] uniform of Baldur's Mouth's guards and armed with a non-magical [[halberd]].
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, Wulf was employed by Baldur's Mouth and its editor-in-chief, [[Ettvard Needle]]. He was tasked with guarding the broadsheet's main entrance from unwanted visitors and critics of the gazette's editorial direction.
